author: _shemnon
content: extdatacopy was in a prior draft of some of the data opcodes, but was dropped.

author: _shemnon
content: What the sstore2 contract does is exactly what we need to deprecate: arbitrarily copying words from code it doesn't own.  Now this can be slightly re-worked to allow contracts themselves to voluntarily serve data they have.  Instead of deploying blobs you would deploy a small contract with a large amount of aux data, and that contract would respond to a function to ask for data at a particular data index and return it.  So data contracts must be self-contained.  We can even do this in legacy EVM, this does not require EOF.

author: _shemnon
content: Data contracts that explicitly intend to share data can continue to do so, just add the function.  Other contracts that are not intending to share data won't be forced to.
